title: Bug 45145: Second window comes to front when using the first
OB: When switching from another application to one of the Eclipse windows, clicking on a docked view or perspective should not cause the other window to come to the front and overlay windows of other applications.
EB: Currently, when I switch from another application to one of the Eclipse windows and click on a docked view or perspective, the other Eclipse window comes to the front and overlays windows of other applications.
SR: To resolve this issue, the behavior should be modified so that clicking on a docked view or perspective in one Eclipse window does not bring the other window to the front, thereby preventing it from obscuring windows of other applications.
